isis.stitle: HYDRO-MAX™ BRAKE BOOSTER AND MASTER CYLINDER - REMOVE - MASTER CYLINDER

svcproc.title: MASTER CYLINDER
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 7 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Block the vehicle wheels, disconnect battery ground cable.

Place a container under the master cylinder to catch brake fluid. Then disconnect the hydraulic brake line hex fittings (Item 5) from master cylinder (Item 6). Cover the brake line ends as soon as they are removed and plug master cylinder outlet ports to minimize loss of brake fluid and prevent fluid contamination.
Disconnect wiring harness pressure differential switch connector (Item 7) from pressure differential switch (Item 8).
Remove four hex flanged nuts (Item 9) securing the master cylinder (Item 6) to the Hydro-Max booster (Item 10).
Remove relay (Item 2) and relay mounting bracket (Item 4) as an assembly from Hydro-Max™ booster threaded studs (Item 11).
Pull the master cylinder (Item 6) away from the Hydro-Max™ booster (Item 10) until the master cylinder flange clears the threaded studs (Item 11) of the booster.
